1.text: And Job will answer and say,

2.text: Also today is my complaint bitter: my hand heavy over my groaning,

3.text: Who will give, I knew to find him: I will come even to his place.

4.text: I will arrange judgment before him, and I will fill the mouth with proofs.

5.text: I shall know the words he will answer me, and I shall understand what he will say to me.

6.text: Will he contend with me in great power? No; but he will put in me.

7.text: There the upright one disputed with him; and I shall be delivered forever from my judge.

8.text: Behold, I shall go before, and he is not; and behind, I shall not understand for him.

9.text: The left hand in his working, and I shall not behold: he will cover himself on the right hand, and I shall not see.

10.text: For he knew the way with me: he tried me; I shall come forth as gold.

11.text: My foot laid hold upon his going, I watched his way and not softly.

12.text: From the command of his lips and I will not waver; from his law I hid the words of his mouth.

13.text: And he is in one, and who shall turn him back? and his soul desired, and he will do.

14.text: For he will finish my appointing: and many such with him.

15.text: For this I shall tremble from his face: I shall consider, and I shall be afraid of him.

16.text: God relaxed my heart, and the Almighty caused me to tremble.

17.text: For I was not cut off from the face of darkness, and he covered misfortune from my face.
